description:
Crepes really do hit the spot after a late night but they do provide a dilemma drunk me might not be able to solve... sweet or savory? During my visit, I ordered a banana and Nutella crepe with some whipped creme. It was absolutely delicious and packed to the brim. There was so much Nutella I had something akin to peanut butter mouth. You need a good glass of milk with some of these sweet crepes. 

The problem was that while I was waiting, they made so many amazing savory crepes that I almost regretted my choice (at least until I tried it). The smells were amazing and I almost sank the place with how much my mouth was watering AND THIS WAS ALREADY AFTER A DINNER. 

I can't speak to which is better, sweet or savory, but I do know that the next time I am here I will need to get two just so that I do not have to decide between them. Well, then I will just have to decide which ones I want from the huge menu...
author: Andrew V.

description:
From reading all the awesome reviews others had here, I was expecting the same and instead I had a mediocre blah tasting crepe. I looked thru the menu and had a taste for the strawberry, kiwi and honey crepe. 

The strawberry was thinly sliced and small morsels of kiwi. All I can taste was honey and nothing more.
author: Len L.

description:
Like all the other reviewers here... the crepes are really good. The guy is quick, and I love how late they are open.

We ordered the banana Nutella. There's two small tables inside, so we got it to go and ate it while walking to the car. It was really delicious.

Would be a 5/5 if they had ice cream crepes!
author: Jessica S.

description: Happened to walk in here on a whim, and was really impressed by all the options. I was craving something really sweet, so I went for the sugar butter crepe, but It was nothing great at all. I asked them to add a little cinnamon to add some flavor too, but the sugar was just too little. It didn't taste as good as I was hoping, more of something like a plain crepe with unsalted butter folded on itself.
author: Haylee M.

description:
Came in for a late night sweet craving and was not disappointed 10/10. Fast, professional, yummy, and reasonably priced. 
I would say the only negative thing I can say is the place could use a woman's touch in the decor
author: Limor R.

description: This place is so bomb. My favorite crepes in all the land. The crepes themselves are so buttery and luscious. I know they use real butter when they cook them cuz I watched, but seriously just a crepe alone is delicious. I can never choose between savory and sweet so I usually get both I love the classic Nutella and strawberries and for savory I Stan the 2 eggs turkey and cheese crepe. The owner is always there smiling and taking everyone's orders and cracking jokes. Awesome place and they're open late and take credit card. What else can you ask for!!! Go!
author: Lorenzo H.

description:
This is a cute little french inspired creperie! Very thin and european style crepe with basically whatever you would like in it either savory or sweet. I would say $9 was a bit pricey for the nutella banana strawberry crepe. It was good but not the best crepe I have had.
Seating inside is limited so you are mostly standing and eating either front of the shop or in there somewhere.
author: Merve C.

description:
These guys have been taking care of me late night since 2016. Professional, courteous, takes care of customers. There's not much more you can say about a great crepe location open until 2 AM. You have to try their crepes, out of this world. 

Thanks again Crepe Oooh La La
author: David B.

description: Please skip this place.  They'll take your money and then won't provide you with any service at all.  I encourage you to go elsewhere if you have the chance.
author: Emily O.

description: Please don't go to this place.  They'll take your money and then won't provide you with any customer service whatsoever.
author: A B.

description:
One of the best easy late night eating options in the area.

My husband's a regular at this spot, and when I used to join him on his evening excursions here - it was evident that this spot is a staple for many.

Crepes Ooh La La is a family run business and you can tell that everyone working here truly cares about having satisfied customers. Most of the staff even seem to know customers by name.

The crepes are massive here, and remind me of the thick buttery crepes we would get from sidewalk vendors in Paris when we were younger. I love watching them make the crepes. Seeing the crepe batter be spread out with quick ease on the hot griddle and then adorned with fresh toppings is meditative.

For savory and sweet crepes - this spot has a nice selection of options. The Banana Nutella Crepes and Turkey Egg and Cheese crepes are always a delicious call.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Sorry all, food here is great but have to leave a 1
Star for the service. Ordered my crepe to go, went home and found out I had the wrong one. Ran back over and he told me he admits it and he'll have the right one for me in 5 minutes. Proceeded to take all the orders and prepared about 7 orders before mine. Waited about 15 minutes and reminded him that I was still here. Then he made mine. People orders, waited, were done eating and left before he remade mine. That's not good service.
author: Wasif Z.

description:
Super delicious and the most classy drunk food I've had in a while. Okay... maybe not drunk drunk but two moscow mule drunk. They have a variety of flavors and I really sank my teeth and demolished the feta, spinach, tomato, and smoked turkey crepe. 

Batter could have been better because it was a bit hard but it held all the fixings inside it well. 

Doesn't hurt the wallet for an $8 crepe of hot deliciousness. Quick service but not great seating options and sorta dingy. I didn't give a care in the world about the seating. The food stole the show.
author: Cindy W.

description: Great place, highly recommend if you are in San Francisco.  Can go for a meal or a sweet treat.
author: Dustin F.

description:
On a rainy night last weekend, we wanted to finish our evening off with something sweet (and close to the apartment), so my friend and I searched Yelp and stumbled on this place. My friend loves crepes and after looking at the pictures and how big it was, we were sold. 

When you arrive you'll notice a long counter area that takes up most of the joint. There are small tables for pairs to sit at, a viewing station to watch the crepes being made and a bathroom in the back. If you can hold your restroom break, I would suggest it. The bathroom toilet didn't have any water in it and overall seemed really sketchy. The staff was nice; it was just one man who eventually had a couple of friends come and visit him throughout our time there. 

For my crepe, I got the nutella and banana crepe for $5.50. OMG, the size of this crepe! It's huge! They fold it into a flat cone and shove bananas and nutella in it, topped with whipped cream and served with a spoon. It took a while to finish it and sooooo good! This is certainly worth the price and 2 people could easily share this. I love how they took a classic dessert typically served on a plate and made it into a mobile treat. Get a lot of napkins though. You'll need it haha. 

Overall, good place to grab an awesome dessert. They also serve savory crepes so I'm sure there's something for everyone. Come in and check them out!
author: Rockne H.

description:
Along Polk Street, there are two creperies. One of them is The Crepe House, and a couple blocks down, is this one, Crepes Ooh La La. This place is more of a takeout place since there isn't any place to sit on the inside. Anyways, I came here with a friend for dessert since The Crepe House was closed and when I came in, I was amazed by the wide selection of crepe fillings for both sweet and savory crepes. I'm very partial to orange, so I went for the orange marmalade along with almond powder, coconut, and whipped cream. 

Five minutes later, my crepe was served, and at first sight, it looks like a normal crepe with whipped cream on top. The crepe is also a bit flimsy on the top, and that could be due to the fact that I didn't have any solids in my crepe, which probably means I need to add some fruit next time. When I bit into it, I was surprised by the spread of the orange marmalade on the inside, the overwhelming sweetness pervading through my mouth. As I was halfway done with the crepe, I was wondering where the almond powder and the coconut were when I finally made contact with the coconut. I was expecting coconut flakes, not coconut nuts, but at least I found where the coconut was. The almond powder was subtle and was also nested near the bottom. In my opinion, the almond powder and the coconut didn't do much for me, and I could have done without it. In all fairness, the orange marmalade probably just overshadowed the almond powder. 

In my opinion, if I were to order the same thing again here, I would just get one filling and whipped cream, and I think I would have been satisfied with just the orange marmalade and whipped cream. Other positives about Crepes Ooh La La is that it is open past midnight, and the crepes here are reasonably cheap for a dessert on Polk Street. I would come back here for the sweet crepes and am interested in trying out the savory crepes here next time. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a full meal or a dessert on Polk Street, and I'm looking forward to my next visit here.
author: Nelson X.

description:
Love this spot. The crepes here are bomb.com! Not to mention that they close late is a plus. 

Great customer service, quick and ready to go. Would definitely recommend it. 

Only thing is that you can't sit and eat here. Which is perfectly fine with me.
author: Margarita V.

description: This is the real deal.  French/Moroccan owners who know how to make a true crepe.  Awesome crepes, many flavors/combos including the traditional ones. Mostly carry out - only 2 small tables and lots of adult men hanging around.  Sketchy part of town smelling of piss and weed.
author: Laura S.

description: Best crepe everrrrrrr. Owners and staff are awesome! Great hospitality! Got a banana Nutella strawberry crepe. Plus points for wrapping it up like a sandwhich. Easy late night eats!
author: Christine J.

description: Friendly staff, clean facility, courteous service, and great sweet and savory crepes.
author: Rawi M.

description: Perhaps Crêpes Ooh La La gets a lot of their great feedback for feeding drunk munchies, but as sober crêpe enthusiasts, Future Hubby and I give our best compliments for the outstanding customer service and for making the crêpes so beautiful, tasty, and addicting. We appreciate how they are light, crispy, and easy to eat by hand. This place is quicker, cleaner, and less pretentious than the Walnut Creek location without compromising the quality.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Not an exceptional crepe experience, but definitely does the job!

We were here for SantaCon and had a little case of the drunchies that desperately needed to be cured!  We came across Crepes Ooh La La and had to go in.  It was open and there wasn't a long line, so naturally it was perfect for us.

I ordered the smoked salmon and cheese crepe, which was very nice.  The price wasn't super expensive so I didn't expect a lot of salmon, but I was pleasantly surprised when I bit into it.  They do do well in that department.  The thing I didn't like a whole lot was the fact that it didn't look like the crepes were made fresh to order.

I noticed that when my crepe was made, it was just picked up off a stack of pre-made ones, which bugged me just a tad.  

Anyway, the crepe experience ended up being a success.  I do wish it was a bit cheesier though.  The crepe was also fairly crunchy, which I wasn't expecting.  I do wish it was a bit softer, but our bellies were filled and we were able to continue with the SantaCon festivities!
author: Kevin K.

description:
Ooh la la!! Ultimate late night munchies spot. Thin n crispy made to order raspberry crepe u will dream about once gone.

Sunday 1am I finally have the opportunity to try without a half hour wait normal on Fr/Sa night. Endless options to ponder if your in line. After mnimal debate I order a raspberry crepe. 

I watch the dough as it hits the hot plate. Its the exact amount needed to cover the plate. A tool is used to spread it out so its perfectly even. Soon fresh raspberries and a bit of sugar are added. Not talking three or four berries either... this is a whole bunch. I see lemon as an option and a real lemon comes out to drizzle over the crepe. Nope, no fake lemin squeeze bottle here. I am assured by the chef that some whipped cream would make it perfection.

It was perfection. Hot and crisp and tart and just wonderful. Wrapped cone style easy to enjoy on the go.  I can see why people wait in line for these on a Friday night... well worth it.
author: Stefan T.

description: Perfect dessert for the end of our night! The two gentlemen working display excellent, fun customer service and we are so glad we went! Super fun environment-- I wish that there was room to sit inside so we could have stayed longer. We ordered the Nutella crepes and enjoyed them on our walk back to our car. Highly recommend
author: L B.

description: Extremely delicious vegetarian savory crepes! Great price and the service is quick! Best stop over if you are partying on Polk street  and want to grab something quick, tasty and not expensive! They have great options and variety in the menu. The crepe was so light and the spicy sauce added an extra punch to the taste!
author: Premila M.

description:
This was a wonderful experience. I went there with my wife and daughter just after 6 pm,when the place opens. 

It really is a "hole in the wall" place - two tables, four chairs. The guy behind the counter is incredible, cooks, waits on customers, all with patience and a smile.

The food is outstanding. We had three types of crepes, a salmon, jalapeno, spinach, avocado, and sour creme crepe, a cheese, tomato, and avocado crepe, and a strawberry, raspberry, and nutella crepe.

All three were just wonderful. I highly recommend this place and will send my friends!
author: David M.

description:
Uhhhhhhh.............yum!

I came with family after dinner and ordered the king lias with strawberries. Ohhhhhhhh yeah. So good! I love this place! Definitely big enough to share, or to take home for leftovers because crepes always taste better when it's made with love by someone else! I can't wait to go again. My mouth is watering just writing this review.
author: Lynn C.

description: This is the best crepe that I've ever had. It's the right amount of crispy and soft, folded up and easy to eat on the go. Favorite is nutella and fresh raspberries. The guys making the crepes are also very friendly.
author: Karima H.

description:
I got the crepe with steak, cheese and jalapenos (and maybe onions?  I forget).

The crepe was thin and crispy, just as it should be.  The filling, however, left something to be desired.  It seems that the "steak" is actually just ground beef, and there was way too much of it.

It's a shame because the bites that weren't just a mouthful of ground beef were really delicious.

I'll try this place again.  Hopefully they'll do a better job balancing out the ingredients next time.
author: Jason F.

description:
My favorite place to go to when I'm on polk aside from the dirty dogs. 

Salty goodness and they take card! Super nice and they have such a good variety of sweet and salty mixes. 

I got the good morning(? The #1) and it was good. I liked the eggs but i was also a little buzzed so i can't remember exactly what was in there. Reasonably priced and a convenient distance from the bars on polk.
author: Linde H.

description: My credit card got cloned here. Had to fight 2000 in charges after using it here (brand new card never used anywhere else before). STAY AWAY... their crepes are def not worth it.
author: Santiago A.

description:
Be carefull and check the order when u order here,
Because if the original price for the crepe is 6.42$ this guys charge the customer 7.45,8.49,or 9.45$ ,we generally don't check the prices but this guys are charging higher than the actual price wich is against the law,try to check your order listing and check how much they charged you,,when I asked them and showed my previous bills,the person at the register spoke me with a attitude.
author: Sohail A.

description:
Amazing crepes, friendly folks. Enough said! I only wish they were open during the daytime :'(

My favorites: turkey egg and cheese crepe and the banana nutella crepe
author: Arjuna R.

description: Went in at 12:30 am but they close at 1 am but it was nice of the guy letting us walk in and order crepes very late and I ordered a Nutella peanut butter banana crepe it tasted amazing I would recommend it. He even let us dine in and he didn't show a salty attitude so I was happy. There's not a lot of room to dine in but it was good for a midnight snack.
author: Jasmine K.

description:
Vraiment super.

Genuine French crêpes with dozens of traditional and contemporary flavors.

Try a crêpe au citron or the ever popular Nutella & banana with a dash of grated coconut and a light chantilly topping for a real treat, or maple syrup for a more American experience.

The smoked salmon, tomatoes and basil is a creative marriage of many cuisines and well worth the detour for a late night supper.
author: Lord Lancelot D.

description:
If you're craving something sweet late at night in the area, Crepes Ooh La La is the way to go! 

December has been a month of indulging on sweets so when I smelled the crepes and walked past the store, I resisted... then I turned around and looked at the menu... and managed to walk away. A few minutes later I walked past looking through the window, and the guy working came out and insisted I come in and try the "best crepes in town!" So, of course I caved in...

The main reason I didn't to indulge on a crepe was because I didn't want to eat a whole one for myself (gotta watch the waistline!) and insisted that my bf shared half with me. He said no. And to eat most of it by myself.

I decided on ordering the banana nutella crepe, and it was heavenly! So good!! I was super surprised! The crepe was also made really quickly and efficiently! The guys working there were also super friendly and funny.

While I was noshing away on my crepe, my boyfriend kept fighting for more. He ended up eating half, psh, and we were fighting for the last bite. Yum!
author: Janet H.

description: Ordered beef and cheese crepes, it was THE BEST savory crepes I've ever had! The crepe was literally packed with beef and the cheese melted in my mouth! Only downside is it was wrapped only in thin paper and aluminum foil, made it a little too hot to handle. But after all, its the best!
author: Rosita O.

description: This is definitely my favorite crepe place in SF. Service is absolutely amazing. The crepe maker was so quick and attentive. Me and my friend will come without doubt. In only few minutes we had an amazing experience. The crepe was big enough and the fruit was sweet and fresh. Loveeeeeeeee it
author: Saida S.

description:
If you haven't already, I highly recommend trying this place! They're not just the best crêpes in SF, but the best and most authentic I've had in this country.

When I lived in Paris, I had a few crêpe stands near my flat, and I'd often order them with just confiture de fraises (strawberry jam). I've tried crêpes in the U.S., they're still delicious in their own way, but only when you load them with strawberries and Nutella, and even still they're not nearly as good as a simple French crêpe with jam. That is, until I tried this charming little eatery. 

I ordered a strawberry and Nutella crêpe, while my boyfriend has the turkey, egg, and cheese. Mine was absolutely INCREDIBLE, and he really enjoyed his as well. The batter was the perfect consistency, cooked to the exact crispness it should be. This is totally the place where I'd feel confident ordering something simple with strawberry jam and know it would turn out delicious. 

The staff was also amazing! We stopped in last night after seeing a movie at the French Alliance, and enjoyed the opportunity to chat a bit in French with the gentleman making the crêpes and the woman who rung us up. You could just tell they were lovely people, and they made us feel extremely welcome. 

It's a small space, but you can easily enjoy your crêpe at a table, or eat it while walking down the street. It's very clean, the ingredients are fresh, and it's interesting to watch your crêpe get made by an expert. They have great hours, and are open late. 

We loved it here so much we'll continue making it our Tuesday night after movie treat.
author: Angela F.

description:
The crepe was amazingggg. Best crepe I've ever tasted. 
However, they do not let people record how they make it :"((. That's sad thou.
author: Tú C.

description: Best crepes, not too mushy or too thick, perfectly cooked with a nice crisp edge! Don't let the appearance of the place fool you. I really wanted to eat crepes and I came accross this place, not much space to sit down, but do yourself a favor and try one, you won't regret it!
author: Elena C.

description: Omg guy , definitely best place to tried creeps . I came all the way from Portland , Nutella , banana and strawberry specially this one . Good costumer service and pretty decent price for SF .
author: Dimitry A.

description: OMG! I've been to the Crepes Oh La La in Walnut Creek and haven't been such a big fan of that location, but the crepes here are the best --nice and crispy! On a Saturday, we were welcomed by a super outgoing owner with an authentic San Francisco personality. With so many changes going on in the city, I love running into businesses that capture the real sense of why I fell in love with San Francisco. This is a grab-and-go place with no seating, but feel free to stand along the wall and eat. I will most definitely come back when I'm in the city again!
author: Moua L.

description: Love coming here when hanging out on Polk! Crepes are soo good, esp the chicken tomato cheese bell pepper and onion one!! My go-to spot after a long night at the bars across the street and it's also never packed....surprisingly!!! Never had a dirty dog (my stomach always hurts from those) after finding this spot!
author: Chelsey V.

description:
I went here with my cousin after we watched Lapsely concert. We were craving some snack and we decided to look for any place that are open late and we found this. Its small inside and it has couple table to sit. 

The place is pretty chill. It was late at night so it wasnt busy. I ordered their banana chocolate crepes and you can see them make it. It was warm but delicious. They wrap it in foil and give you napkins so you can definitely eat it while walking. I would recommend people to try it.
author: Kathleen L.

description: Super cozy atmosphere! I ordered the smoked salmon and cheese and was pleasantly surprised with the amount of salmon! Delicious and generous. The employees are very cheerful and welcoming. A homeless woman approached and asked for food and one worker whipped up a warm crepe for her. Happy to see compassion this cold season! There is a huge menu of savory and sweet crepes. Definitely swing by if you are in the area!
author: Alyssa Z.

description: This is a really good place to get a different late night grub after drinking at nearby bars.  If you're wanting savory, any crepe with cheese will hit the spot. If wanting sweet, then the signature nutella, strawberry, banana is so money!  It's so good and worth the hassle to drive and look for parking if you're coming from elsewhere in city just to satisfy a late nightcrepe craving.
author: Mikey L.

description:
And here goes...one of many reviews I'm playing catch up on.  

My friend was craving for some crepes and we all just happened to be bar hopping on Polk St., and she wouldn't stop raving about her favorite crepe place in the whole wide world.  Okay, she didn't exactly say that word for word, but you get the gist.

Even though the door was closed, the owner (I presume) secretly ushered us in and said they were open, but I'm guessing due to the amount of heavy foot traffic related to Santa Con, he didn't want all the drunk people inside causing any trouble.

Our group opted for one of the sweets; nutella is always a big hit and one of the meat; ham if I remember correctly.  Made right as we ordered and wow did it hit the right spot after an afternoon of drinking, I can see why my friend spoke so highly of this place.  We were the only guests and got VIP treatment, delicious crepes at a really cheap price and enough to feed a group of completely sober ;) individuals.
author: Kevin C.

description: Overall service was nothing to cheer about. It's a cute space but service is very slow. I ate here a few times waiting to meet with clients near downtown and it's the least chain-like store to go into. The coffee is decent but the crepes on multiple occasions is just flat out boring. The flavors presented are not anything special and on all accounts of me ordering from them each came out soggy and tasted like you're eating a block of sugar on a pancake. Parking is easy at the garage on the street. The wait time on average is 10 minutes+ during an afternoon so you can check out the small menu thoroughly.
author: Jessica G.

description: Their Nutella strawberry raspberry crepe is super good, especially before or after going out on Polk street. Highly recommend. Haven't tried the savory crepes but my friend got them and they looked good too. I'll be back!
author: Inga C.

description: They are so friendly and the crepes are sooooo good !!! No matter sweet or savory. They close really late so its perfect for a late night healthy-ish meal. Thank you !!!
author: Valentina L.

description:
$6 for a strawberry and Nutella crepe. 
No line
Lots of seating 
Casual 
Easy place to walk to after a night out 
I'm a happy camper
author: Jenn R.

description:
Student from France & in San Francisco for one year, I highly recommend this place!
As a food addict I always enjoy my crepes at Ooh La La =)
The team is awesome & they work with the smile.
Will come back soon for sure!
author: Myriam J.

description:
You almost have to ask yourself, why are you not eating a crepe today?

I grew up lucky enough to have a strawberry and whipped-creme crepe as a kid.  I has blown away.  I've loved them ever since.  Crepes Ooh La La is really good.  I'm hooked.  This is one of the better neighborhood fixtures of the last two years on Polk Street.

Crepes are France's burrito.  This place hast a great selection of savory and sweet crepes.  I've had a pretty good range.  If you are new to crepes, they can point you in the right direction.  Their crepes are good, and hearty.  Every savory crepe I've had has been good.  For dessert, I'll just say, it's hard to beat strawberry.  (orange marmalade or Nutella are good candidates, though)

Overall - a good experience.  The place is well-staffed.  About $6-7 for a crepe.
author: Adam S.

description: This place is a gem on Polk! Not a fan of heavy greasy food, especially when I've been drinking. Crepes oh la la was yummy, healthy, and chased the drunk munchies away! The staff was welcoming, quick and knowledgeable. Will definitely be back!
author: Lauren C.

description: This place is so GOOD! And they'll make the crepes go whatever order you want! Super friendly family owned business. Great neighborhood yummy spot. Savory and sweet are great.
author: Candice N.

description: This place is legit. I live in Outer Parkside and will skip the multitude of "creperies" in the Sunset District to make the trek to Crepes Ooh La La. I thoroughly enjoy the authenticity and taste of the crepes made here. The guy who makes the crepes is always professional and quick. They also generously provide to-go boxes if you have leftovers or want to enjoy your meal elsewhere. I would highly recommend Crepes Ooh La La to anyone who finds themselves craving high-quality crepes at a non-pretentious spot in San Francisco.
author: Pia D.

description: This is hella delicious..... can't tell, price and the food are worthy. You can image that you are eating the same thing in Paris. Rock it
author: Lucille H.

description: They are strategically located on Polk Street where all the bars are at. They are open late for you to get your drunk munchies on. I had the spinach, mushroom, and cheese crepe and it was delicious! My friend had the smoked salmon and basil one and that too was amazing.
author: Lena V.

description:
After a night of bar hopping, we all have at least a couple of needs before heading home to collapse in bed.

1. Carbs
Savory crepes filled with protein? Carbs filled with sugary, fruit goodness? Check!

2. Toilet
Access to a bathroom that has TP and doesn't reek is a gem in itself, especially in this 'hood.

3. Seating
Because you've probably done a good amount of walking and want to sit/talk to your friends without having to shout.

A four instead of five since the crepes aren't outstanding, but they are yummy and well-priced.

Thanks for meeting all of my needs, Crepes Ooh La La. Whether I'm sober or not..we shall meet again!
author: Jenny Q.

description: Best crepe I've ever tried so far!!! The owner is super generous. He made crepes according to our request (soft, crispy, more ingredients, etc.) Only one minus point is the stall is kinds aged.
author: Gina N.

description:
Alright. This would've been an uncontested 4.5 stars but the counter dude did me so so wrong. Let me set the stage my friends:

My buddy, visiting from out of town, wants to go out for a Thursday night. I'm like, cool, sure, how about the Polk? Off we go. It was a blast..drinks and more drinks. We ended up at Crepes Ooh La La for some food. I needed to sober up. I order my fav, house special, and...wait a sec a girl gets in front of me and before I can pay she orders. The counter dude, after a second, turned to me for $7. Here's where he messed me up. The girls some how thinks I'm paying for her, thanks me profusely, but I'm a bit drunk here and don't realized what's going on. He hears all this going on is laughing. I get my food, I'm enjoying it, and he gives her the food. she takes it and because she thought I paid goes to leave. He calls her out, and says hey u need to pay.

Duuude! I was too drunk to realize what was happening, but dammit man the counter guy should've realized I would've payed. Instead he forced her to do the walk of shame! And poof, she was gone into the night before I could do her right. Shame on you Crepe Ooh La La...and for me for being an accidental jerk.
author: David E.

description: I thought this place was good but not great. I had a savory turkey and pineapple crepe and a sweet Nutella/raspberry/strawberry crepe. Worked out great for lunch the next day! The savory crepe had typical deli meet and some pineapple. Nothing really creative compared to some crepe places I have been.  Tasty but nothing to write home about. Next time I would probably just stick with a sweet crepe.
author: Linda M.

description: This is an amazing place, thanks to the gentleman who made us our crepes he was very courteous and friendly definitely going back soon!
author: Taylor H.

description:
I got a savory chicken special one. After finishing it, I couldn't help myself, I had to get a chocolate and banana for desert!

They've got the freakin whole package. 

Small bonus: they got the cleanest and best smelling bathroom in town. And no im not drunk/high,  it's just a super rare thing around here.
author: Tamer G.

description:
I had a bad experience here.

This may be an okay place, but bring no more than the number of people as the number of stars I gave. Honestly, these folks don't know how to handle a crowd. SLOW is the defining characteristics. Why? Because they make a whopping one crepe at a time. ONE! I came with a group of 7 people (not really that many, imo) , and I ordered last. By the time the guy started making my crepe, the first person in my group already finished his and was bored, and the crepe maker was still taking his time to clean the hot plate. This place needs to invest in another crepe hot plate.

And the crepe was underwhelming. I ordered pineapple and whipped cream, and they didn't even bother to spread the content slightly, so the last two thirds was an insipid crepe and pineapple. No powdered sugar was offered to make the crepe a touch more savory either, but they did offer powdered chocolate and cinnamon to salvage my experience slightly.

Ultimately, this is an ok hole-in-the-wall dessert place for late nights... But there's much to be desired in customer experience. I would return (with one or two other friends at most), only because it is convenient and the crepe isn't completely horrible (but what I ordered was definitely not impressive enough for me to suffer through my experience again).
author: Elton C.

description: Never disappoints. Crepes here taste awesome. Even though they're pricier than what I'd expect for crepes, they're worth it. The guy working nights is really good at what he does. Amazing! Strongly recommend for amazing late night food in Polk Gulch!
author: Olga A.

description:
The crepes here are so DELICIOUS! I tried a strawberry with nutella crepe and a King Lias (claimed as the sweetest crepe on the menu and that's absolutely true!). My favorite fruit is strawberries and I was surprised that the crepe contained so much of it! I absolutely loved that they do not skimp out on ingredients. I expected a tiny bit of Nutella but there was so much inside when I got it that it was hard to cut with a plastic knife since it kept oozing everywhere, but I'm not complaining. That's what I love about it! An overfilled crepe is simply amazing. 

For a late night snack, I couldn't finish my crepe since it was so big! I think I negated all the calories I burned at the gym, but it was so worth it! Guess I have to try harder tomorrow. 

The seating inside the place is a bit tiny, only three tables with a limited amount of seats. It gets a bit busy after people go to the clubs and stop for a late-night snack so expect big groups and happy/drunk people chowing down on sweet and savory crepes. 

The crepes are made in the front of the store so you can watch them make your crepe if you like and the smell is just so delicious inside the store. 

This place accepts credit cards so it's a plus!
author: Maybo L.

description: Went with the cheese, smoked salmon, spinach, avocado, sour cream, and jalapeños. Hands down best crepe I've ever had.
author: Sam L.

description: I really don't like giving negative reviews however I feel people need to know that the owner here is very rude and unprofessional. Also they do not open when they say they will,which is their perogative but please change your hours if that is the case. We attempted to come here because I thought this was a good business but found out the hard way that is not the case. Huge disappointment.
author: Jena H.

description:
Their crepes are okay.. but their service is kind of awkward?

My friend and I went in here after dinner and there was literally no one in the shop. He took my order and then went on to go make my crepe. Nice for me.. but my friend was like uhhh...? Wouldn't it have been more efficient to take both our orders and then make both our crepes? We ended up just getting that one and then leaving.
author: Angela L.

description: Being sober at 1am and needing a sugar fix this is the place to go. The drunkards roll in and the customer service piles on! These guys know how to crepe!!! Thank you fellas!!!
author: H V.

description: ive tried many crepes and this place hits the spots plus slim the owner im assuming is soo energetic and a sweet man come thru sf yassssss
author: Alyzah J.

description: Crepes Ooh La La is a small, take-out centered savory and sweet crepery that makes a darned good smoked salmon crepe. I came around 8PM on a weekday night and there wasn't really a line. I got to watch the chef make the crepe right in front of me which was a great!  The pricing is fair (not cheap and not expensive for San Francisco) and this place is also not good for big groups as there isn't much seating at all. I absolutely loved the flavor blends of my smoked salmon, basil, and tomato crepe, and I think the only thing I would've done differently at my visit here is order a second crepe.
author: Andrew H.

description: My friend and I were craving crepes and this place was the nearest to us, so we decided to try it out especially since they have a 4 star rating and are open late! However, we were both disappointed and unsatisfied with our crepes. I ordered the nutella & strawberry crepe and it wasn't anything special. My biggest issue with the crepe was how hard and crunchy it was. I prefer my crepes to be balanced with crunchiness and softness, but this one was overly crunchy, which I didn't enjoy. My friend said she watched them make the crepe, and saw that they have the crepes already pre-made and they just reheat them with every order, which may have caused their over-crunchiness; so they are not fresh! On top of that, the strawberries in my crepe were pretty sour and not really sweet at all and the whole crepe is wrapped with a paper towel, which makes the place seem cheap. Other than the crepes, the staff was very nice and friendly, but I don't think I'll ever return even if I was in the area. I'd rather make the 15 minute drive out to the Richmond District for Genki's crepes instead!
author: Christian V.

description: Service really nice. Best crepes and cheap. Open late at night if you're hungry there we go. My fav is Nutella with fresh strawberries. Ummmmm yummy!!!
author: Amy K.

description:
So after my terrible experience a couple doors down at Quetzal Internet café, I came across this place.Now THESE people know how to make a great crêpe! And even taught me how!
and by the way don't be fooled by their hours. They are open right now even though it says closed. They are open from 11 AM to 3 AM. What an amazing thing to eat after partying all night
author: Cerraeh L.

description: Came here after a concert. Just wanted something small and quick. Place is old so yeah it's a bit run down. Wasn't anything special. But the crepe was good, likes the texture of the crepe.
author: Fiona B.

description: This place is the perfect late night food spot when you're out on Polk Street. I normally gravitate toward the savory options... I really like the turkey cranberry crepe, as it tastes like the holidays. They have lots of vegetarian and pescatarian options as well, which makes my roommate very happy.
author: Sarah P.

description: Nutella and banana crepe was amazing.  It was very thin and slightly crispy.  Just the way I love it.
author: Helene L.

description: My sister and I have been searching through the city for good desert places open late when we are in the mood for something sweet! We had banana Nutella crepes with tons of whipped cream! So yummy!
author: Cheska P.

description:
I wrote a review expressing how not impressed I was with this place and this is what the owner sent me back. The slave comment really bothered me because my wife did not yell at his employee. She simply was trying to speak with him through the glass of your window because the owner didn't have the decency to open the door and speak with us like human beings. He shut the light off and basically yelled at us and told us to leave. Why would anyone want to go to this place with a owner like this?


New!
 Photo of Abdel F.
0 friends
1 review
Abdel F.
San Francisco, CA
Send Message
For your review of: Crepes Ooh La La

I'm so happy that you won't come back again. When someone disrespect one of the employee I usually shut them down. We were breaking the fast after a hard long day. My friend tried to be nice to you by telling you we will be open in 30 minutes but your wife sir was shouting at him saying we should be open at that time. We make our crepes with love and we interact with our customers with kindness. But when the customer starts thinking we are his servants or slaves he or she crosses the line! Have a nice life sir!
author: Chris H.

description: These crepes are amazing. They taste delicious and are so filling. Very cheap. Especially given the size of the servings. Ask Jose for the secret menu ingredients!
author: Y Z.

description: The crepe tastes ok ...the crepes were stacked up on the side and warmed up when I ordered, which I didn't like ! after the honey filling, my 2 crepes were soggy..and the honey were all over my hands and clothes
author: Thao D.

description: One of the best spots in the city! With the sweetest people! We came here when they were about to close and they still served us with amazing nutella
author: Mahshid S.

description: Excellent crepes, friendly service and cheap! Also, the anesthetics and music were very fitting for the food that were serving.
author: Robert Z.

description: It was quick and easy. A sweet ending to an awesome night. I had the nutella, banana, coconut crepe. It was great :) No seating in the place, but I managed to successfully eat while walking and not spill, so WIN!
author: Alexandra S.

description:
This establishment is a little hole in the wall but the food and the service were outstanding!!

We had two savory crepes (cheese, egg and smoked turkey; monterey cheese, artichokes, spinach and sundried tomatoes) and one sweet crepe (Nutella, peanut butter, banana cream and whipped cream).  The three crepes were absolutely delicious, which wasn't unexpected given the great reviews I saw on Yelp before we went there.  But what wasn't necessarily expected was the special effort and great service provided by the sweet Algerian man who served us.

Support this establishment, have great inexpensive food!!
author: Jaime C.

description: Bests late night crepe I have had in a while! The guy who runs the place is an awesome dood :-) going there second time in 2 days!
author: Sahil B.

description:
Oh yes.

Delicious sauteed chicken and veggies crêpe for dinner.

Divine apple and caramel crêpe for dessert.

Both packed with the aforementioned tasty ingredients and well priced at $12 for the pair. Impressed with the quality, quantity and the friendly, speedy service.

Yes indeed.
author: Jason B.

description:
You've already had pizza drunk. Try a savory crepe.

Pretty bomb. It's good by itself, but it's better with sriracha.
author: Steffie H.

description: Late night crepes after work. Not bad for the taste and price. Be here soon again! Fast and easy also
author: Jenny C.

description: Their crepes are delicious, fluffy and a generous portion! Will definitely come back for more!
author: R. K.

description: this place is wack af. first off i walk in ,order my own crepe off the menu which comes out to $5.50. Then the manager ups the price to $8.93. How are you gonna charge me 3 extra dollars out of nowhere... playin games and shit... I calculate the damn prices and show him and he tells me what i ordered is listed off the menu as 5 dollars already instead of extra add ons... complete bogus. I WAS HEATED... he's gonna charge me for a crepe listed off the menu when i was creating my OWN adding my OWN ingredients.. THEN WHAT.. the prices changes to $9.96... JUST LOVELY... Fuck this crepe joint, don't bother coming here and receiving the worst service of your lifetime. You're better off making one at home. LUCKY IM FORCED TO GIVE YOU ONE STAR MOFUCKA
author: War S.

description: Really tasty warm crepe for a reasonable (By SF standards) price. Go here if you are in the area looking for a snack. Also the guy who made the crepe was really polite and seemed like a good guy.
author: Adam J.

description: Great business! The food is fantastic, the owner is charismatic, the location is great. It's tiny, almost standing room though there are a few tables. We got the Ian's Fave and the Spinach, Cheese, and mushrooms. Both were delicious, made with fresh ingredients, made to order. I would go back just to watch the owner make the crepes!
author: Brenda M.

description: This place is insanely amazing they had some trouble handling the crowd cuz they were hiring ... But now it's just fine.. Keep doing what u doing guys
author: Youcef S.

description:
Let me preface this review by saying I have been here on a handful of occasions at times ranging from 6pm-1am and I am happy with my decision every time I go. 

* You should go to Crepes Ooh La La with the understanding that it is not a gourmet sit-in excursion i.e. not the kind of crepe place where you'll get arugula and a fried egg on top. "Normal" savory and sweet crepes here are very solid though. 

* They offer you the option of eating it for here, to go, or for walking so it's very convenient. When you ask for it to-go or for walking, it usually stays pretty warm and not soggy since they wrap it in foil instead of a cardboard box (at least with the savory crepes). 

* In terms of late night or on-the-go, you can't beat this place, especially for the price.

* One annoyance is that it seems like the time they stop taking orders is arbitrarily decided by the mood person behind the cash register even though hours are posted outside. This uncertainty is disappointing when you've trekked over here with 20 mins to closing and the crepe chefs are still around, especially since it's not in the best of places to be walking around freely at that hour.
author: Tasmin S.

description: Came here after those drunken nights on Polk street. It's strictly to go, there are no seats, but their menu is huugee! I got the spinach and cheese one and it was pretty bomb. The prices range from $5-$6? Anyways, for it being on Polk street on a Saturday night, it came out quick, was a nice portion and this place was surprisingly not crowded! Now I know where to hit up when I'm hungry bar hopping on Polk Street!
author: Veronica A.

description:
I had the sweet special for the day - nutella, banana, raspberries and whipped cream. It was amazing. Some of the most legit crepes I have had outside of Paris!

The area is a bit shady though and more than a few unsavory characters came into the shop to ask for money or just wander around. The tables and chairs are also a bit rickety so if you're coming here, it's not for the ambience.

Solid food. Not so great location.
author: Jeffrey Q.

description: I love coming here! Their crepes are really fresh and flavorful. It's also open late night.
author: Namrata J.

description: A good crepe, 3.5 stars, but I'll round up. Doesn't appear to be different crepe skin for savory vs sweet crepes. I had the beef, onion, cheese, and jalapeno. Tasty and greasy, really hit the spot. Service was fast and friendly.
author: John H.

description:
Excellent crepes and the staff are very friendly.  

It's hard to walk by and not stop for a Nutella crepe. And even though you may say no to whip cream the cook will turn to you with a huge smile and convince you otherwise. the man knows what he is doing because let's face it, a Nutella crepe with strawberries must.have.whip cream.
author: Sabrina J.

description: Cheap and delicious crepes! Stones throw away from the Regency Ballroom. Perfect for after-concert munchies.
author: Amiel L.

description: Decent price for yummy crepes. The amount of sweetness is just right in the dessert crepes.  you get a decent-sized crepe and have the option of adding whip cream.
author: Helen H.

description: White chocolate and banana was delicious! The crepe was nice and light and was a perfect cap to my dinner around the corner at Fly!
author: Melissa B.

description:
Love, love! (I would have put a third love if the place were a little hygienic)

Their savory and sweet crepes are so yummy, I could eat more than 1 at a go!

We walked in the middle of the night (and given that no pizzeria was open in and around Polk St), Crepes it was. There weren't many other people around. We ordered Crepes with:
Spinach, Feta, Mushrooms and a bunch of other stuff
Same as above + sundried tomatoes
Banana walnut nutella.

I like how the crepes are wrapped, making it easy to eat without needing a knife & fork.  I do think it's portable :)

I like how they are open at the wee hours of the night.
I like that they have coffee too.
I like that they accept credit cards. That is a winner for me.
author: Ranjani S.

description:
Was craving for something sweet and when I found out that there was a crepe place near my apartment I was so happy.  I've eaten in Crepes A Go Go in SOMA how different could it be.  Walked over to Polk Street. Crepes Ooh La La is in a good location situated around the restaurants and bars in the Polk Gulch.  It is a small space, when you walk in, it doesn't look very tidy and clean but my expectations were low. They have an extensive menu with different kinds of crepes to choose from from sweet to savory crepes depending on what you feel like ordering. 
The service was fast. And the crepes that I ordered were delicious. The place was casual,  with a welcoming atmosphere. You could see the cook right in front of the restaurant making crepes among other things. I ordered a strawberry nutella ans my usual favorite banana nutella. The cook put very generous portions of banana and strawberry.  What I love about Crepes is that it is food you can eat while walking or you can eat it right in the restaurant.  The place opens at 5pm and closes at 2am so its perfect when your craving something sweet late at night!  Will definitely come back.
author: Maria M.

description: This lone star has nothing to do with their food, it has to do with the management.  They advertise their hours as being open until 2am but we went at 9pm and they were closed.  Not sure if this is a recurring thing for them.  My thoughts are that if there is a situation causing you to close your business early you should at least put a sign on the door apologizing to your potential customers for the inconvenience.
author: Tiffany A.

description: Well what can I say about this place...... I love it!!!!! Even though my diet wishes I didn't!!!!! I usually get the dessert crepes, yum who can say no to a crepe with Nutella bananas and raspberries.... As a mater of fact simply writing this review is making me want to go get one. Place isn't I'm the best of neighborhoods and sometimes there are bums by the front door which can be annoying. Also not very fond if the stench of pee when you walk out of the front door but hey that's the price you pay for loving a place that's located on sutter and Polk. The guy who works seems like he is there everyday 24 hours a day because I don't think I've been there yet without him being there making my crepe. They are open Til about 2:30-3am on the weekends so if you ever get a craving for something sweet or savory for that matter late night def give this place a try.
author: Dmitriy G.

description: Seriously..  Smoke a fatty and go eat here. Your mind will be blown!! Best Crepes I've EVER had! And I eat a lot of crepes ;)
author: Apple S.

description:
Crepes are one of my favorite things in the world!  Crepes A Go Go is my favorite in the city, and Genki's is 2nd.  I've taken cabs just to go here in the evening.

For this place....

THE GOOD:
 - strawberry nutella banana walnut crepe was nice and warm :)
 - HUGE variety of sweet & savory crepes
 - they have coffee & other food for the non-crepe lovers
 - good location by some bars
 - hours, it's open until like 5am
 - the owner is really nice, friendly, and funny

THE BAD:
 - long line around 1:30 am - 2:30 am
 - crepe was not easily portable (i.e. can't eat it while walking)

I come back here over and over gain and LOVE taking friends and family form out of town here, it's "soooo SF".
author: Amy P.

description: Was in the city looking for something sweet and noticed this crepe shop. There is a variety of different crepes. I had a nutella and banana crepe and it was so delicious! I have to come back! :)
author: Dany A.

description:
When you need something sweet, get yourself a savory crepe. No doubt. And when you don't know what kind you want, get a banana and nutella one like I did and you'll be one happy person. Like really though, you can never go wrong with nutella. 

The server/crepe maker was a friendly guy and didn't mind my obnoxious tipsy demeanor when I stopped here one party night in SF. Plus he made one heck of a crepe. OH! And since I asked for it to go, it was wrapped up semi-burrito style...pretty nifty. Oooh la la indeed!
author: Christine R.

description:
PHA-NOM-I-NAL

I've been non-stop dreaming about crepes after having one for the first time last weekend. Let me tell you, nothing in the world is better than a crepe at 3 am in the morning. Thank you Crepes Ooh La La for making that dream imaginable. 

I would have taken a picture of my delicious avocado, cheese, and tomato crepe. Unfortunately, I ate it too fast. 

Peace.Love.Crepes.
author: Kim C.

description: Now Creperies is that a word? It is now!! Well they come and go. But this one should be here. It's delicious. Service was clean. Last time I was here there weren't on yelp but now they are! And they are always excellent. Whoever the gentleman was that worked pride weekend at night  (on Sunday) was excellent!! And always is.
author: Ronni G.

description:
I absolutely LOVE this place! I always come here when I want something a little "different" than the usual Thai or Vietnamese food that is so abundant around my work neighborhood. 

The menu seems to feature an endless combination of savory and sweet crepes. I have gotten the 
+ spinach, mushroom, cheese crepe
+ banana and nutella crepe
+ chicken, mushroom crepe

you can go wrong, I've loved every crepe I've ordered from here. And yes expect to be very full by the time you put down your knife and fork. 

every time I visit Crepes Ooh La La I know what to expect...
* no lines (usually pretty empty little cafe)
* the very friendly chef who takes and makes my order
* super fast service
* a piping hot freshly made crepe wrapped in foil to-go! 

Whenever I bring back a crepe from Ooh La La I get jealous looks from my co-workers. *evil laughter*
author: Eva H.

description: Crepe was pretty good, I would get it again. They messed up my order and 1 of my employees orders though, missing things and adding things here and there (c'est la vie...)
author: Chris N.

description:
They have a really good savory crepe with spinach, artichoke hearts, and cheese. 

I recommend this place for a good sweet or savory snack in between your bar crawling.
author: Pam M.

description:
okay changed my mind AGAIN.  came back here last night with a friend.  crepes were bigger this time i think because we were chatting up the cook and watching him make the crepe...

it was delicious!!  hit the spot this time... as opposed to last time i was too drunk to really comprehend.  prooobably coming back if i'm on polk at night
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Yay crepes! 

The man working was friendly and patient with me as I decided what I wanted -- apparently it's not socially acceptable to order a whole jar of nutella...

They have so many option for fillings, both sweet and savory.

Quick, delicious and I suppose you could make it healthy but what fun is that?

Thank you manfriend for introducing me to this awesome creperie!
author: Sara P.

description: the best 'creperie' in the city. Crepes are prepared with passion by a Uber adorable chef. A must try!
author: Olivier L.

description: Open late, delicious crepes, and friendly service. The Nutella banana is my go-to. So good!
author: S. C.

description:
Bacon wrapped hot dogs, jack in the box, taco trucks, pizza stands....and then there's Crepes, the junk food's evil healthier cousin.  

Sure crepes can get greasy on their own accord, but while normally eaten with a lighter fare and more greens, its amazing how this simple wrap came into the spotlight for drunken foods.  And here we are, at one of the few locations, yet prime locations where drunkards are a plenty.  

And the best part is, you "think" you ate a healthier choice as opposed to those bacon wrapped heart, but when you (and by you, I mean I) start venturing away from the simple spinach and mushroom to the turkey, avocado, cheese, and mushroom, that's when it gets serious.  At this point, there is no point of return except finish that 2 pound load to quench that drunken munchies.  

And before you pass out with a heavy stomach and enter a deep deep snore, you think to yourself what a great idea it was to get crepes, cause I tell ya, it was mighty delicious.  Even if they have premade crepe sheets ready for reheating and the turkey is just chopped up turkey slices from the deli, that ultimate combo cannot be broken and taken lightly for.  

Therefore, I am a fan.
author: Vincent K.

description:
A small unassuming annex to a coffeeshop. This place is relatively new and the little frenchman working there is such a sweetheart. You can tell he's passionate about his creations, and they turn out amazing! 
Crepes made with love are the best kind! nomnomnom!
author: Spring L.

description:
Cheese. Smoked turkey. Cranberry sauce.
This crepe was amazing. Hot fresh, tasted  like thanksgiving. Very affordable for any pockets
author: Papp J.

description: They open at 11 am, which seems quite late, but the crepes were really good and the staff very friendly.  Would definitely go there again.
author: Lindsey H.

description: Came here after eating some Thai food. Been craving a crepe for a long time and let me tell you. The crepe was cooked perfectly, you bitt into it and it melted like butter in your mouth.. Perfection! We got Nutella, strawberries and whip cream in our and we were in heaven. Plus the lady at the register was real nice and the man that was making the crepe was great too.. Two thumbs up. Definitely worth it
author: Jon Z.

description:
Second time being there tonight. The crepe was good but not as great as the first time..the crepe itself was really spongy and had no crisp. I can't believe I'm actually writing about this but whatever.

I guess the thing that really bothers me is that they raised their prices. But not only that, the prices on the board above the cash registers is wrong. Those are the original lower prices. Look inside the menu for the increased prices.

My banana and chocolate crepe to go came out to $5.76. Not horrible.. but not worth it. Also.. when are they open?? They don't keep regular hours.
author: Misty M.

description:
FOOD:
1.) full house special - like a  breakfast crepe so good
2.) straw ban nutella - yumm something bout the skin ...

*Deffffinitely willing to come back here again!


SERVICE
nice folk. they open hella late! perfect for a late night grubbin yumm


ATMOSPHERE
small, very to-go looking. 1105
author: Angela L.

description:
I cannot believe how much people are blind , i worked at that place and everything is dirty and broken and the owner doesnt care at all . 
Restaurants should also be ranked from their employees . ....... im spookeD !!!!!
 all right the crepe tastes good ..... but what about the cleanliness ???or how the employees  are treated ??? 
Dont you care about theses criteria before you spend your money somewhere ??
author: ali r.

description: LOVED this, best crepe of my life. Had the king crepe walking to-go. Nutella+bananas+whipped+raspeberry+coconut+$7.00 for a huge crepe? I'm sold every single time. Killer crepe, fast and friendly service. Great little cozy spot on Polk.
author: Aaron S.

description: Pick what you want and put it in a crepe! Sounds good to me. I think they could to more with their own recipes though. There's not much happening creatively or in any culinary way. Its really pretty basic which is good, but not amazing. Same with the whole look of the restaurant. Its pretty plain and could use a redesign in a big way.
author: Dexter H.

description: How often does one crave for crepes? You would, once you have tried this place.  I went back to France earlier this year and decided to do a taste test when I came back.  Bottom line, I kept coming back to Ooh La La and tried different crepes (savory/sweet) 4 weekends in a row.  Great-tasting, paper thin and fresh!  Personal favorites: Turkey, spinach, eggs & cheese; Nutella & banana; Fresh raspberry and cream; Plain chocolate.
author: Bennie L.

description:
Randomly came across this hole in the wall while searching for dessert with a friend on Polk St. on a Friday night. I've avoided most of the crepes places in San Francisco because they seem too gimmicky, but this one immediately caught my eye. You could see the guy making the crepes from the window and the prices were very reasonable. 

My friend and I split the nutella & strawberries crepe ($5.75) and I couldn't really have asked for a better end to my evening. Plus our server/crepe-maker (the only person working there!) was so nice. 

Was it the best crepe I've ever had? Obviously not; I've been to Paris. Was it an overall pleasant and delicious experience? That's what s... I mean, yes :)
author: Richa A.

description: Came here after seeing a movie in a Friday night. It was kinda run down and dirty looking on the inside, but it lived up to its good rating with the food. I ordered a banana Nutella crepe. It was cool to watch them make the crepes. They were huge, crispy, and delicious. It also had a generous amount of Nutella on it, which other places I've been to skimp on because Nutella can be pretty pricey. I've never had a crepe that yummy before.
author: Bear A.

description:
I'm usually not a fan of crepes because they are expensive and you don't get much food... This place changed my mind!  I usually get the cheese/artichoke heart/sundried tomato crepe and I can rarely finish it!  I've also had their chicken/cheese crepe and the chicken is really good.  Their prices are the most reasonable I've ever seen at a crepe place and they always make your order very quickly.

They are NOT OPEN MONDAYS
author: Maddy F.

description: always amazing for a late night snack.  Try to avoid the post-last call bar crowd though or you could be waiting for a while.
author: Chad T.

description: Literally my favorite crepe place in the world. This sweet man- I'm not sure if he's the only one who works there, but he's the only one I've seen in all the years I've visited this place - is so dedicated and thorough in his store maintenance and cooking. The crepes are large, delicious, warm and fresh. They're heavenly drunk food, too, and the place is crazy popular at night when people are bar-crawling up and down Polk st.
author: Cecilia A.

description: I used to go to Crepes a Go Go when they were on Union St., but now they have changed their name and moved to Polk St.  The crepes still taste great and you can't go wrong if you have a craving for something that's quick and you can eat while on the go.  The spinach and mushroom crepe is good.
author: L H.

description: Great crepes. I like usually get the one with salmon, spinach, caramelized onions, jack cheese, and tomatos. Great service from all of the staff. Opens till 3am on weekends. Good place to people watch drunk people after hours while your having a bomb crepe.
author: Darin Bom N.

description: Friendly service and the best kept lil' secret in the city! Friendly service and a smile are sure finds when you visit this Polk Street original!
author: Paul R.

description: Great crepes and the place is owned by a French guy so he knows what he's talking about.
author: Baptiste P.

description: Lost in the mix of all the shops on Polk...you can thank me now for bringing this place to your attention. Open late night after the bars shutdown. Best savory crepe in town. You'll go dumb for the Smoked Salmon and Spinach.
author: Brent N.

description: This place has saved my drunk ass twice now.  Salmon and spinach on a delicious crepe.  Semi healthy, open late, friendly staff and cheap.  The perfect meal for a late night pub crawl.
author: Corey V.

description: This place is awsome I had the Cheese, Smoked Salmon, Spinach, Avocado and Sour Cream Jalapenos which was excellent.
author: Phillip W.

description: A great crepe place, sober or drunk!! Good prices and a nice selection of ingredients. They lure you in, making crepes fresh in the window! Get the jack cheese/tomatoes/caramelized onions combo!! Total greatness!! And a few frenchies I know are fond of it, so that says something.
author: Shannon R.

description: Great prices for great crepes!  The staff is always friendly and accommodating.  My kids love stopping by after-school for a treat of crepes with butter, sugar, and don't forget the whipped cream! (My kids make sure I don't).
author: Gary D.

description: I think I came to this spot drunk tihs weekend. Can't really recall how good it was, but it got the job done.
author: Haileab B.

description: My friend and I went for a late night dessert and were pleasantly surprised by how good the sweet crepes were.  And the cute guy working there made for some nice eye candy.  Did I just say that aloud?  Oops.
author: Mike G.

description: Savory or sweet, this place is a great stop for a crepe. I am a big fan of the savory ones which has great toppings like avocado, turkey, salmon and spinach. Dessert ones are pretty typical like fruits and Nutella. Opened late so it is a perfect and convenient ending for the Polk bar nights.
author: Ed L.

description: The "go-to" place for food after a great night of dancing or drinking!  My only complaint is what's up the bathroom?  It is ALWAYS out of service!
author: Lidiya B.

description: It was after 9:30 PM and we got hungry so the decision was made to try their crepes. I liked the apple cinnamon and Kris liked her cranberry turkey so no complaints. This is a take-out kind of place and its located right next to several popular Polk St. bars. That's the primary advantage of this joint. Beware of the one man operation situation here because there's technically only one person working the whole restaurant :-).
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description: This place is bomb-delicious! Sometimes I forget how fortunate I am to have this joint walking distance from my girlfriends house. It's basically hidden next to a smoke shop on Polk cue the omnipresent piss stench and glow of nearby bar neon. It's not much to look. But, from my experience thats usually where you find the best grub. I recommend the smoked turkey with egg and cheese on the savory side. For a sweet crepe you can't go wrong with the Nutella and banana. Oh and the guy working isn't some angry hipster trash who's paying his way through art school and wants to make you feel small for being in his establishment. Phew...sorry I digress. The guy working his a$$ off here seems to always have a smile on his face. I went there last night (Monday) and they were closed. I nearly hit the deck in the fetal position. In summation: delicious crepes, huge portions and a reasonable price make this a place you can't miss on Polk.
author: Johnathan D.

description:
Let me start by saying that I have been a long time fan of this chain, tried all of their locations in the past, going back to when they were called "Crepes A-go-go", and have always loved the crepes. I think that maybe the night we were there was an aberration, but also it sounds like the main cook/owner wasn't there, so perhaps that made the difference. 
The main reason for giving a one star review was that as soon as I opened the crepe, I found a hair in it. Yes, it matched the short black hair the cook had, and he admitted as much. The reason I was tearing the crepe apart was because I asked for mushrooms in mine, and instead of the regular chopped fresh or sauteed button mushrooms he stuffed it with cold, slimy, canned oyster mushrooms, that totally didn't fit in with all the other fresh ingredients. So I guess it was a good thing the crepe was full of nasty mushrooms, because otherwise I may have eaten the hair. The crepe itself was undercooked and gluey in the middle. 
So, if it was just the hair, I maybe would consider having him remake it and hope for the best, but this was 3 strikes for me. To his credit, the guy refunded our money in full. We'll still go back to the Berkeley location, where over many years we've never had any problems...
author: Sushi M.
